name: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: The Gate Keeper
description:
"Who says dinosaurs are extinct?"

I've played this deck dozens and dozens and dozens of times, with many alterations. Even in a tournament setting, it performed very well. It has only lost to the two finalists at a Store Champ, as well as a friend (once) who has been crushed by it time and time again. I am not bragging about the deck, but asking for help. I feel like setting up Yog and Dino is very slow, and it has econ problems early game. Is this a piloting error, or a deckbuilding one? I also want to add exposing and/or net damage protection now that H&P is coming out (hence the Deus Ex). Anyway, any advice is appreciated, hopefully you guys can inspire me.

Note: Decoy is there instead of Plascrete. Probably an incredibly risky move, but its cheaper to install and I usually encounter sea source over midseasons while playing against scorched decks. Punitive doesn't terrify me nearly as much. Bad idea? I don't know, you tell me :P

name: The Many Faces of Chaos
description:
I designed this deck with the Professor in mind, the idea is to have a deck with some potent 1x tricks with tons of tutoring and recursion to bring out what's appropriate.

The deck is designed to be able to setup quickly with Corroder, Mimic and Zu or it can setup for the long game with Morning Star and Torch. Test Run into scavenge for the high cost breakers and SMC for the low cost breakers and tricks.

3x Sharpshooter to also enable paintbrush fuelled Morning Star if appropriate (and for general face checking and Power Shutdown defence).

Magnum Opus is hugely important, I would suggest that if you don't see a MO or a SMC in your opening hand, you should probably mulligan unless you have a diesel or two and want to risk it.

Use and abuse Sneakdoor at the right moment, hammer R&D with Keyhole and break into remotes with Femme when possible. You won't be able to do it all at once, but bring out the right tool at the right time and you can sow up victory quickly.

name: Cant Wait to play this !
description:
This deck will be so damn FUN.

COMBOS : Mushin no shin Project Junebug and make mindfuck if it is Agenda or not. It is rush deck, should be enough to have 9x Hedge Funds but I think about melange mining corp to be sure..

AGENDA The Future Perfect + Caprice Nisei.

name: Everything you can do I can do code gate 1.1
Stop, Double time!
Kill it with fire!
Starlight Control (I'll...figure out a creative name later)
description: This deck utilizes Starlight as a surge and strike campaign. The turns where there's nothing going on, I can focus on a little control and build up a teensy bit, but the second there's something to run after, I can check it with Uplink, surge with some major money card and fire away. Using cards that give me a lot for a little bit (especially Underworld Contacts saving me clicks that would spend to get more money), this definitely is a different play style, but it has been pretty effective.

name: [NAPPING INTENSIFIES] v4
Jinteki RP - Untrash variant.
description: Trying to mix it up with some Untrashable (db0 as always, much credit) thoughts, and some other cards. I'm not satisfied with the ICE yet, but it's all WIP at the moment. Sundew + Hedge + Gifts should be enough econ, but have to mulligan for a Sundew or Gifts for sure.

name: First Jenteki deck ever..and probably my last. :)
One Beale to Rule them All [v3.0]
description:
Crazy Concept. Just score one Beale. Thats your only goal. Granted, you have to get 13 counters on it. Everything in this is geared toward that goal. Let them have every other agenda.

R&D and HQ get all the data raven and matrix. Put a couple ETR and nisei on your remote and start pumping and praying :) If you fail ... try again :)

name: Wyld Chyld
description:
The focus of this deck, as the name implies, is Wyldside. Like most other Shaper decks, your plan will be to build your rig and run, with a focus on R&D. But with Wyldside in the mix, the pace and style of how this happens is drastically different.

The biggest difference is your economy. Instead of relying on clicking for creds with Kati or Magnum Opus, it will be focused on Sure Gamble, Dirty Laundry, and Daily Casts. And with (at least) two cards being drawn a turn, you will be surprised how well this keeps up (eventually, when you draw the Magnum Opus, it is a nice supplement, especially for handling huge late-game ice, but it really isn't needed in the beginning). Your rig consists of Corroder, Gordian Blade, and Dino-Garrote. It gets built like “normal”, drawing into breakers, and using Test Run + Scavenge to dig for them where needed. Plus, you have Atman and Femme Fatale to help handle any big annoying stuff that comes up in the late game. And the meat of your point scoring will likely come from Indexing and The Maker’s Eyes.

But the truly best part of this deck is in the late game. Once your rig is built and you are out of cards, instead of selling Wyldside to Aesop's, just use a Levy AR Labs Access to start it all over again! But this time around, instead of drawing into boring cards to build your rig, you will be seeing nothing but economy cards (Sure Gamble, Dirty Laundry, and Daily Casts) and tricks (Indexing, The Maker’s Eye, and Escher)! And this time around, those Test Runs and Scavenges can be used to reposition Atman and Femme Fatale very cheaply, for insane surprise attacks on servers, or just to make it real cheap to hit R&D.

So, seriously, who the hell let this kid into the nightclub?!?!

name: Shaping Coming Events
description: I decided to try and play Shaper a bit like Criminal, making this deck very event-heavy. Get out a few programs to try and cover as much ground as possible, then focus on events and cards that let me play those events over and over again. Once I've exhausted my Same Old Things, Deja Vus, and my economy, I use up my Levy Ar Lab to get everything back and start all over again.

name: NBN First Attempt
description:
My first attempt at making NBN Fast Advance, with the Midseasons + Psychographics combo.

Not entirely sure how to build the deck.

I'm working with 1 Core (hence only 2 AstroScript), What Lies Ahead, Cyber Exodus, A Study in Static, Future Proof, Opening Moves, and Fear and Loathing.

I'm sure I could be making use of that unused influence, just not sure what to use it for.

name: Double Andy
Bringing the Hammer Down v1.1
Aggro Chaos Theory
NEXT to Nothing At All. Nothing At All. Nothing At All.
description:
Stupid sexy ABT. >:(

Modded version of the original. Fiddled with some ice, rejigged agenda density, added some Haas for free clicks / run bait, got a panic button JHo because I'm a diaper babby who needs my JHo comfort blankey I guess?

Hope you dig it.

name: Tricky Advance
description:
Here's my planned decklist for Jinteki Fast Advance.

I opted for just running 40 cards to run into more Trick of Lights, more Celebrity Gifts, etc. I also opted for 2 SanSans, 3 Jacksons, 3 Ice Walls, when I definitely could have gone 3 SanSans, 3 Ice Walls, foregoing the Jacksons.

I really like the agenda suite, making it first to 3 agenda's wins. The thing about these agendas are the NAPDs are tough to score, and the first Medical Breakthrough stolen enables the next two to be scored from hand. The rest you can just score from hand.

name: Kate Testing - Suggestions Welcome!
description: Just trying to run a huge rig and have options upon options ;)
